meanings.definition: A person who behaves in a servile or obsequious manner.
meanings.sent1: The kowtower always agreed with everything the boss said.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a kowtower when she constantly praised her friend, even when she didn't mean it.
meanings.sent3: The kowtower's constant flattery made everyone roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: Being a kowtower in the office was like being a puppet on strings.
meanings.sent5: The image of the kowtower bowing and scraping was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: To act in a subservient or obsequious manner.
meanings.sent1: He would kowtower to his superiors to avoid any conflict.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to kowtower to anyone, but she felt pressured to do so.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to kowtower to the dog, bringing him toys as if he was royalty.
meanings.sent4: The politician would kowtower to the lobbyists, hoping for their support.
meanings.sent5: The student would kowtower to the teacher, always seeking approval.
